dt: {bc}to blend thoroughly into a harmonious whole

dt.t: … that fine and funny book, in which horror and laughter are {it}commingled{/it} …

dt: {bc}to combine (funds or properties) into a {a_link|common} fund or stock

dt.t: Proceeds from the sale have been {it}commingled{/it} with other funds.

pt: {sc}mix{/sc} {sc}mingle{/sc} {sc}commingle{/sc} {sc}blend{/sc} {sc}merge{/sc} {sc}coalesce{/sc} {sc}amalgamate{/sc} {sc}fuse{/sc} mean to combine into a more or less uniform whole. {sc}mix{/sc} may or may not imply loss of each element's identity.
{sc}mingle{/sc} usually suggests that the elements are still somewhat distinguishable or separately active.

pt.t: fear {it}mingled{/it} with anticipation in my mind

pt: {sc}commingle{/sc} implies a closer or more thorough mingling.

pt.t: a sense of duty {it}commingled{/it} with a fierce pride drove her

pt: {sc}blend{/sc} implies that the elements as such disappear in the resulting mixture.

pt.t: {it}blended{/it} several teas to create a balanced flavor

pt: {sc}merge{/sc} suggests a combining in which one or more elements are lost in the whole.

pt.t: in his mind reality and fantasy {it}merged{/it}

pt: {sc}coalesce{/sc} implies an affinity in the merging elements and usually a resulting organic unity.

pt.t: telling details that {it}coalesce{/it} into a striking portrait

pt: {sc}amalgamate{/sc} implies the forming of a close union without complete loss of individual identities.

pt.t: refugees who were readily {it}amalgamated{/it} into the community

pt: {sc}fuse{/sc} stresses oneness and indissolubility of the resulting product.

pt.t: a building in which modernism and classicism are {it}fused{/it}

shortdef: to blend thoroughly into a harmonious whole
to combine (funds or properties) into a common fund or stock
